scenarioDescription:
The UZ For Exoplanetary System


Overview

UZ For is a star with 0.7 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

UZ For is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the UZ For system


UZ For b

UZ For b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2011-09, using the eclipse timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is 5.90 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of UZ For b is 2003.400 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, UZ For b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


UZ For c

UZ For c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2011-09, using the eclipse timing variations method. Its semi-major axis is 2.80 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of UZ For c is 2448.600 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, UZ For c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system UZ For, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: UZ For - System With 2 Exoplanets
